intro: Microstylis crispifolia, commonly known as the crinkled leaf microstylis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, slender stems and narrow, wavy-edged leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces tiny, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in dense inflorescences, which bloom during the late spring to early summer. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories where it competes with other shade-tolerant flora. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Microstylis crispifolia is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
